name: Courtyard by Marriott San Diego Solana Beach/Del Mar

reviews.text: Location is close to several restaurants and beach access. Including 3/4 mile from Pizza Port, a terrific brew pub with good food. Hotel is not really on the beach if that is what you are looking for. Rooms are acceptable to Courtyard standards but not the newest. Lobby and common area have been recently redone for a very nice feel. Service was very good.
reviews.title: Good location, Nice atmosphere

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel the past few years to attend the annual Surf Cup Soccer tournament. The hotel is location is convenient - close the Del Mar Polo fields, beaches and various restaurants that parents and kids can enjoy. The hotel is also clean with spacious rooms. Staff is friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great location, clean with spacious rooms, nice decor and friendly helpful staff.

reviews.text: Stayed with my wife and 2 kids. Room was very clean and spacious. Located 2 blocks from the beach...perfect for our 2 day plans. Everyone we dealt with was friendly and we would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent value and customer service

reviews.text: Still a 5 star in my book. Even if for a moment, one of the tips of the 5 stars were briefly bent, a staff member would have it fix right away. The onsite Bistro cafe has great food & service. Clean property that is within walking distance to shops & loads of local restaurant. Will be back again, as there is NO reason to experiment at other properties.
reviews.title: 5 Star in my book

reviews.title: A pleasant time away

reviews.text: Have been visiting this property for over 10 years. Staff is friendly, courteous and helpful. We like the location for access to beaches, race track and restaurants. Property has recently been remodeled and we like what they have done.
reviews.title: Our first choice for San Diego are

reviews.text: My husband & I arrived with our boys on a Friday about an hour before check-in. We had no problem immediately getting our room. We stayed in a 1 bedroom Executive King Suite with a sofa bed , 2 balconies, and a small kitchenette. We did not have a view & we were not poolside, but this didn't matter to us as we spent most of our time at the beach or walking around Solana Beach. The bedroom is spacious with a very large 2 sink counter area, whirlpool, shower and separate water closet. The living area was also large with a 2nd TV and room for an Aero Bed with the sofa bed pulled out. The kitchenette was not stocked with any utensils, dishes or pans but did have a 2 burner cooktop, microwave and small refrigerator. The bedding was fine and the room was updated and clean.
reviews.title: Loved it - unexpectedly modern Courtyard!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great in the Bistro with a contemporary setting, Starbucks coffee and delicious breakfast sandwiches made to order. We enjoyed the outdoor fireplace and used the pool/spa too. The pool is fine, but nothing special. The lobby was inviting & contemporary. The grounds have nice landscaping and on site parking is no problem.
reviews.title: Good Beach Close Hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed here about 4 times and am always happy with the hotel. The main area of the hotel has recently been remodeled. There is outdoor seating where you can enjoy breakfast or a drink by the fireplace. The bathrooms probably need to be re-done but other than that I will stay here again.
reviews.title: Just Back From Wonderful Experience at Marriott Solana Beach

reviews.text: Arrived at MSB on Sunday July 31 folllowing a rough road trip from Phoenix. The front desk crew at MSB could not have been more helpful in getting us into our room within minutes. This team and this hotel really aims to please.....many amentities, courteous and very helpful service and an immaculately clean hotel. A totally enjoyable experience.
reviews.title: Best Place To Stay In San Diego

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second year staying here while visiting Del Mar race season. Rooms are great, have a small but convenient restaurant on site, with a Starbucks. They offer shuttle service to and from the track, beautiful pool, etc. Walking distance to restaurants including Brigantine. We will be back next year.
reviews.title: Great stay for Del Mar Track season

reviews.text: The staff of this hotel is fabulous! They are friendly, accommodating and most helpful. Our children stay there whenever they visit for a weekend or a few days. My husband and I love it because the grandchildren stay with us at our home and we love the time alone with them. It is a win-win for all of us...parents get a night away from kids; grandparents get a night to spoil grandkids!
reviews.title: My family and friends love this hotel. We just keep coming back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend use to rent a condo for her family but this August they stayed less than a week so stayed at the hotel. She has decided in the future all visits will be a hotel stay...the suites were perfect for her daughters and their families. The grandkids love "night swimming"!
reviews.title: Great location and comfortable stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fran Dyer
reviews.title: A great experience at a well managed hotel with fine personnel right in the heart of Southern California beach country.

reviews.text: This hotel is well located for spending time in Del Mar and the other beach citiies near San Diego. And, you cannot beat the Marriott's mattress and pillows for a good night's sleep!
reviews.title: Best Marriott Courtyard yet

reviews.text: Our family just returned from a 4 day stay at the Solana Beach Courtyard by Marriott.
reviews.title: Great hotel...wonderful location.

reviews.text: We all agreed, the hotel is great...immaculately clean...and you could not ask for a better location. The uncrowded beach is a 5 minute walk, and there are several restaurants within easy walking distance. The GM and front desk staff went out of their way to be helpful. We will most definitely be back.
reviews.title: Great spot to visit San Diego area from

reviews.text: I loked for a Marriott property as close to the beach as possible in the San Diego area and found this Courtyard in Solana Beach. The hotel front is right on highway 101, but there are no rooms directly facing this direction. 3 children ( daughters 11 and 1, son 7) , my wife and I had a room with 2 double beds. This is a beach type property, to me that means the bathroom is close to the doorway, the sink is separated by a sliding door from the toilet/tub area - this is tight!
reviews.title: Great location for the 4th of July

reviews.text: Our room was on the upper level, facing the outside rather than the courtyard with the pool. on the upper level we had a balcony facing the courtyard, but our view was of the Bistro( restraunt bldg) roof, and had no view of the pool itself. I was traveling on Marriott Points at 25,000 points per night, this equates to a category 5 property and I am a Marriott Gold member, so this means this room was the best they had available.
reviews.title: My Annual SoCal Summer trip...

reviews.text: Upper level rooms seem to have vaulted ceilings which is great, the 2 double beds were soft,which is what most people call comfortable. But for us this meant the closer to the edge you are the more you feel like you are going to slide off the bed. There was a refridgerator, coffe maker and microwave, a good set of cabinets like an efficiency suite, and you could ask the Bistro for paper plates, bowls, plastic utensils.
reviews.title: Vacation with the granddaughters
